column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=SOMEBODY'S LITTLE GIRL
#Text=If I were just to tell the things that Bessie Bell remembered
#Text=I should tell you some very strange things .

#Text=Bessie Bell did not know whether she remembered them , or just knew them , or whether they just grew , those strange things in some strange country that never was anywhere in the world ; for when Bessie Bell tried to tell about those strange things great grown wise people said : " No , no , Bessie Bell , there is nothing in the world like that . "
#Text=So Bessie Bell just remembered and wondered .

#Text=She remembered how somewhere , sometime , there was a window where you could look out and see everything green , little and green , and always changing and moving , away , away -- beyond everything little , and green , and moving all the time .
#Text=But great grown wise folks said : " No , there is no window in all the world like that . "
#Text=And once when some one gave Bessie Bell a little round red apple

#Text=she caught her breath very quickly and her little heart jumped and then thumped very loudly ( that is the way it seemed to her ) and she remembered : Little apple trees all just alike , and little apple trees in rows all just alike on top of those and again on top of those until they came to a great row of big round red apples on top of all .
#Text=Rut great grown people said : " No , no , Bessie Bell , there are no apple trees in all the world like that . "
#Text=And one time Bessie Bell was at a pretty house and somebody sat her on a little low chair and said : " Keep still , Bessie Bell . "
#Text=She kept still so long that at last she began to be afraid to move at all , and she got afraid even to crook up her little finger for fear it would pop off loud , --
#Text=she had kept still so long that all her round little fingers and her round little legs felt so stiff .
#Text=Then one , great grown person said : " She seems a very quiet child . "
#Text=And the other said : " She is a very quiet child -- sometimes . "
#Text=But just then Bessie Bell turned her head , and though her round little neck felt stiff it did not pop !

#Text=-- and she saw -- something in a corner that was blue , green , and brown , and soft , and she forgot how afraid to move she was , and she forgot how stiff she thought she was , and she forgot how still she was told to be , and she jumped up and ran to the corner and cried out : " Pretty ! Pretty ! Pretty ! "
#Text=One grown person took up the Thing that was blue , and green , and brown , and soft , and waved it to and fro , to and fro in front of Bessie Bell .
#Text=And Bessie Bell clapped her hands , and jumped for joy , and laughed , and cried : " Boo ! boo ! boo ! "

#Text=And Bessie Bell ran right into the Thing that was blue , and green , and brown , and soft , and she threw out her round little arms and clasped them about the Thing that was blue , and green , and brown , and soft !
#Text=And she pulled it over her face , and she laughed and cried for joy -- because she remembered --
#Text=But the great grown person who had brought Bessie Bell to the pretty house said : " Oh , Bessie Bell !
#Text=Then the few people who walked about the world in Fever-time came in to that big house , and they took up that little tiny girl that breathed so softly and so quickly -- just so !
#Text=And they read on her little white night-gown the words written with the linen thread : " Bessie Bell . "
#Text=And they said : " Let us take this little girl with us . "
#Text=They put a big soft white blanket around the little girl and walked out of the big house with her , someone carrying her in strong arms .
#Text=And the big white cat got down off the big white bed and rubbed himself against the bedpost , and went round and round the bed-post , and rubbed himself round and round the bed-post .
